docs.title: Markdown Slides Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to Markdown Slides, where you can create beautiful presentations using simple Markdown.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
This site contains both documentation and interactive slide presentations. You can:

  1. Browse the documentation to learn how to create slides
  2. View example presentations to see what's possible
  3. Create your own slides by following the guides

docs.title: Available Presentations
docs.text:
• Example Presentation - A demonstration of basic slide features
  • How to Create Slides - A tutorial on creating your own slides

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Write slides in simple Markdown
  • Beautiful, modern design powered by MkDocs Material theme
  • Interactive presentations using Reveal.js
  • Easy to deploy to GitHub Pages
  • No complicated build process

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
To create your own slides:

  1. Add a new Markdown file in the docs/slides/ directory
  2. Format your content using Markdown
  3. Separate slides with --- for horizontal navigation
  4. Use -- for vertical slides
  5. Add your page to the nav section in mkdocs.yml

Check the How to Create Slides guide for more detailed instructions.

docs.title: About Markdown Slides
docs.text: This project combines the power of MkDocs for documentation with Reveal.js for presentations.

docs.title: Why Use Markdown Slides?
docs.text:
• Simple: Write everything in Markdown, no HTML knowledge required
  • Flexible: Create both documentation and presentations in one site
  • Portable: Deploy to GitHub Pages with ease
  • Responsive: Works on all devices and screen sizes
  • Beautiful: Modern design with the Material theme

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text: The system uses MkDocs as the base framework, with special integrations to Reveal.js for the presentation capabilities. When you navigate to a slide page, the Markdown content is automatically transformed into a beautiful presentation.

docs.title: Creating Your Own Slides
docs.text: A step-by-step guide to creating presentations with Markdown

docs.title: Step 1: Create a Markdown File
docs.text:
• Add a new .md file in the docs/slides/ folder
  • Start with a top-level heading for the title
  • Add the slide configuration comment:
<!-- .slide: data-separator="^
---
$" data-separator-vertical="^
--
$" -->

docs.title: Step 2: Structure Your Content
docs.text:
• Use --- to separate horizontal slides
  • Use -- to create vertical slides
  • Each slide typically starts with a heading

docs.title: Headings
docs.text:
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3

docs.title: Step 4: Add to Navigation
docs.text:
Edit mkdocs.yml to add your new slide:

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Slides:
    - Your New Slide: slides/your-file-name.md

docs.title: Step 5: View Your Presentation
docs.text:
• Run mkdocs serve
  • Go to /slides/your-file-name.html
  • Use arrow keys to navigate
